Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM, and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 hit Youth A, Youth B and Youth C on their buttocks with a
cord while outside on 4/20/2025.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/29/2025 and 5/14/2025. Youth A stated that Youth B, Youth
C, Staff 1 and herself were outside on 4/20/2025. Youth B and
Youth C picked up a rope from the outside toy bin and began
hitting Staff 1 with it. Youth A yelled at them to stop but they did
not. Every time Staff 1 tried to take the rope from Youth B and
Youth C, the youth would hit Staff 1’s hands. Staff 1 informed
them all that if they kept hitting him, they would have to go back
inside. Eventually, Youth B and Youth C stopped hitting Staff 1.
Staff 1 never hit Youth B, Youth C or herself with the cord.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/29/2025. Youth B reported the incident with Staff 1 occurred
on 4/20/2025. She stated Youth A and Youth B, Staff 1, and
herself were outside, on the patio around 5:30pm. Staff 1 had a
cord that he found outside, and he was hitting Youth C and herself
on the knee with it. Youth C bent over and told Staff 1 to “whip
her” with the cord. Staff 1 hit Youth C and herself on the butt with
the cord. Youth B stated to Staff 1 that, “You hit me in the ass with
it”, and Staff 1 only replied with “so”. Staff 1 then hit Youth A on
her butt with the cord. Youth B stated Youth A told Youth C and
herself that she liked it. Youth B reported she told Staff 2 the next
day what occurred, and he wrote an incident report. She reported
she also told Staff 3 a couple days later and Staff 3 wrote another
incident report. During the interview, Youth B expressed additional
concerns regarding Staff 1. Youth B reported when Youth D first
arrived at Vista Maria, she overheard Youth D tell Staff 1 that they
are going to smoke together when she is released and Staff 1
2

replied “yeah”. Youth B reported Staff 1 smells like marijuana
every time he comes to work.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 4/29/2025. Youth C stated on 4/20/2025, Youth A, Youth B and
herself were outside on the patio with Staff 1. Youth B and her
found a cord and she hit Staff 1 in the head with it. When she
dropped the cord, Staff 1 also hit her in the head with it. Youth C
reported they were joking around. She does recall Staff 1 hitting
Youth B with the cord, but she does not recall where on her body
she was hit. She stated Youth B was laughing when it happened.
Staff 1 has never been inappropriate with her, physically or
verbally. Youth C stated that Staff 1 is a nice person. She feels
due to him being a male; he is being investigated because other
youth try to get the male staff in trouble. She has not heard Staff 1
say he will smoke marijuana with other youth. She reported he
does smells like marijuana sometimes. She also stated that there
was a previous incident where Staff 1 unplugged the phone while
she was on it, and she threw the phone at Staff 1.
Consumer Rights Officer (CRO) was interviewed at the facility
with MDHHS Worker on 4/29/2025. CRO reported he has never
interacted with Staff 1. He is familiar with a previous incident
between Staff 1 and Youth B, in which Youth B threw a phone at
Staff 1 due to him pulling the phone cord out of the wall while
Youth B was talking on it. He is unaware if Staff 1 has ever
smelled like marijuana as this has not been reported. He is not
aware if there are any concerns with Staff 1.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker
on 5/14/2025. Youth D stated she is not aware if Staff 1 has been
inappropriate with other youth, but Staff 1 has never been
inappropriate with her. Youth D was not present for the incident on
4/20/2025. She nor Staff 1 have ever spoke to one another about
smoking marijuana together when she is released. She stated she
has barely had a conversation with Staff 1. She also stated that if
they did speak, it was mostly about music. She reported that Staff
1 does smell like marijuana sometimes.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
5/14/2025. Staff 1 reported that on 4/20/2025, he was outside with
Youth A, Youth B and Youth C. While outside, he recalls Youth B
jumping into the outside toy bin and pulled out a piece of cord that
appeared to be from a weed whacker. Youth B then hit him with
the weed whacker. He kept telling Youth B and Youth C to “chill”
and “calm down”, as they both were hitting him. He stated Youth A
3

kept telling Youth B and Youth C to stop hitting him. He stated
they were outside for about an hour. Staff 1 stated that he did not
hit any youth with the cord at all. None of the youth asked for him
to hit them on their buttocks or any parts of their body. Staff 1
stated that it was only Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and himself
outside on the patio.
He stated he has smelt like marijuana in the past due to the
individual who was transporting him, who would smoke marijuana
while he was in the car. He now has a different person
transporting him from work and no longer smells like marijuana.
He denied ever telling Youth D that he would smoke with her after
she was released.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
5/14/2025. Staff 2 stated Youth B did not speak to him about Staff
1 hitting Youth A, Youth C, and Youth B. He does not know why
Youth B stated that she told him when she did not. He has never
seen Staff 1 hit youth. Staff 2 reported he may have worked with
Staff 1 for a total of 6-8 times between the building of Rose and
Deroy. Staff 2 works day shift and Staff 1 works the afternoon
shift. In his past interactions with Staff 1, he feels Staff 1 is
immature, childish, sloppy and young. He reported Staff 1 has
smelt like marijuana in the past and can recall numerous times of
Staff 1 smelling like marijuana. Staff 2 reported he does not know
Vista Maria’s policy regarding a staff member smelling like
marijuana, so he never reported Staff 1 to Human Resources.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
5/14/2025. Staff 3 reported that she does not work with Staff 1 and
no other youth has complained to her about him. No other youth
has mentioned that Staff 1 smells like marijuana. She reported
that if a staff member smell likes marijuana, it would be
documented by the witness and they would inform a supervisor,
and Human Resources will handle the situation. She stated on
4/21/2025, Youth B asked if she could talk to her, and this is when
she was told about the incident that occurred on 4/20/2025. Youth
B stated to her that on Easter, while out on the back patio with
Youth A, Youth C, and Staff 1, Staff 1 was hitting them with the
rubber from a cord. Youth B stated all youth were hit on the butt
by Staff 1 with the cord. She informed Staff 3 that Youth A and
Youth C stated they “liked it”. She wrote an incident report and
once submitted, the incident report is given to the team leader.
She believed a previous incident with a phone between Youth B
and Staff 1 may have triggered the complaint. She stated that it is
common for youth to make up stories regarding staff because she
4

has overheard youth say they will make up a story about staff to
get them fired. She also stated that if a youth is upset with staff,
they will make a complaint that is untrue.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker a
second time on 5/14/2025. Youth A stated she has not heard of
Staff 1 telling any youth he would smoke marijuana with them
upon their release. She stated the youth will dance inappropriately
in front of Staff 1. She also stated she was a witness to a previous
incident when Youth B kicked Staff 1 in his private area due to him
hanging up the phone on her.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone with MDHHS worker
on 6/2/2025. Staff 4 reported that she does not have any
concerns with Staff 1 and his interactions with youth. He appears
to be very cautious around the youth because he was made
aware that Youth B has a crush on him. She was not present for
the incident, and this was the first time she heard of the incident
and has only worked with Staff 1, 1-2 times. During those times,
staff and youth did not go outside. She has not observed Staff 1
saying anything inappropriate to youth. Staff 1 has never smelled
like marijuana. She is not aware of Staff 1 stating that he will
smoke marijuana with Youth D upon her release or any other
youth. No youth has informed her of feeling uncomfortable with
Staff 1. She has told Youth A and Youth B to change their clothing
when Staff 1 was around as they will dress inappropriately in front
of him. She is not aware of any phone incident between Youth B
and Staff 1.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file was reviewed, and he has one
discipline record that is not related to the allegation.
• Incident report dated 4/21/2025 written by Staff 3: Youth B
informed Staff 3 that she needed to talk. Youth B stated
that yesterday while out on the back patio with Youth A,
Youth C, and Staff 1, Staff 1 was hitting them with rubber
from a cord. Youth B stated all youth were hit on the butt by
Staff 1 with the cord. Youth A and Youth C stated that they
“liked it”.
• Staff and Client Interaction Policy: All Vista Maria staff
should conduct themselves in a professional and
appropriate manner when interacting with the clients in our
care. Employees are expected to establish good working
relationships to foster mutual trust with clients. If you are
ever in doubt as to what is appropriate, consult your
5

immediate supervisor or a member of management
Guidelines for staff and client interaction:
Corporal punishment (spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, pulling hair, etc.) of clients is never,
under any circumstances, permitted.
• Behavior Management Policy: Physical intervention shall
not be used as a form of coercion, discipline, convenience,
or retaliation by staff.
Video Reviewed:
There is no video footage of the incident.
Analysis The facility was found in compliance as per interviews with staff
and youth, and documentation received, there was insufficient
evidence found that Staff 1 physically assaulted Youth A, Youth B
and Youth C.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131
Section Compliance with child protection law; development of plan
Description required.
(1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 3 did not contact Centralized Intake regarding physical abuse
in a timely manner.
Investigation Consumer Rights Officer (CRO) was interviewed at the facility
with MDHHS worker on 4/29/2025. CRO reported that all staff
are trained on mandated reporting.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS Worker on
5/14/2025. Staff 2 reported that as a team leader, he receives
notice of all the incident reports. Incident reports have to be
written by the person who witnessed the incident and submitted to
a team leader who will review the report. The supervisor and unit
manager also review the incident reports. He stated that once the
unit manager reviews the report, someone from quality insurance
will categorize the incident reports by what type of incident it is. He
does recall reviewing the incident report from 4/21/2025 but he did
not sign off on it due to him not working that day. He does not
recall Youth B telling him about the incident that occurred on
4/20/2025.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
5/14/2025. Staff 3 reported the incident between Staff 1, Youth A,
6

Youth B and Youth C occurred on 4/20/2025, and Youth B
informed her of the incident on 4/21/2025. She did not report the
incident to Centralized Intake as outlined in agency policy. She
stated that the incident was supposed to be called in immediately
per policy, however, it slipped her mind which caused the incident
to not be reported for several days.
Documentation reviewed:
• Child Protection Law Compliance Policy: Vista Maria has a
zero tolerance for child abuse, neglect, sexual abuse and
harassment of clients and staff. All Vista Maria staff are
required to immediately report to Child Protective Service
any incident where they have reasonable cause to suspect
that sexual abuse and harassment, child abuse or neglect
has occurred as follows:
1. both verbally and in writing to their immediate supervisor,
2. by phone call immediately to Child Protective Services
and, 3. followed by a written report (DHS 3200) within 24
hours.
Analysis The agency was found in non-compliance per staff interviews and
documentation, of not reporting incidents in a timely manner to
Centralized Intake.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and an acceptable corrective action plan is required.
